column4: I must suggest that in the future Ubuntu has support for installing to USB harddrives by installing GRUB WITH USB support by default when it detects you installing to a usb mass storage device. As it is now you must enter rescue mode, mount the drive, edit the init files to include 4 usb drivers and tell it to wait about 10 seconds in order to let it find the usb drive, and then rebuild the init file with the new settings.
I picked the worst time of day to report this
no one will really hear it here, best to write a spec for it on launchpad
